newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO steady to firm in thin talk.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO steady to firm in thin talk.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Tuesday were assessed steady to firm on overnight crude gains but thin talks as activity gradually draws to a halt towards the year end, traders said.
Traders said prices were expected to rise above Monday's quotes at $119-$121 per tonne as overnight crude had jumped almost $1.00.
But some traders were skeptical, citing the softening of crude prices after the rally.
In the swaps market, the prompt December paper was supported at $122.50/$123.50, up from Monday's $122.25 bid. But January swaps were quoted at $120/$121, slightly lower from $120.50/$122 on Monday.
One Singapore trader told Reuters he was keen to sell his Janaury lifting barrels but could not find any buyers.
But other traders agreed that Chinese oil demand continued healthy for January. They expected enquiries to slow at the end of the week.
Most South Korean barrels for January loading were heard to have been sold out.
